authors.author: Francis Rous Jessie Seymour Irvine William Mure Wi

verse.name: v1a
verse.lines: The Lord's my Shepherd I'll not want,

verse.name: v1b
verse.lines:
He makes me down to lie in pastures green;
He leadeth me the quiet waters by.

verse.name: v2a
verse.lines:
My soul He doth restore again,
And me to walk doth make;

verse.name: v2b
verse.lines:
Within the paths of righteousness,
E'en for His own name's sake.

verse.name: v3a
verse.lines: Yea, tho' I walk in death's dark vale,

verse.name: v3b
verse.lines:
Yet will I fear no ill for Thou art with me
And Thy rod and staff me comfort still.

verse.name: v4a
verse.lines:
My table Thou hast furnished
In presence of my foes;

verse.name: v4b
verse.lines:
My head Thou dost with oil anoint,
And my cup overflows.

verse.name: v5a
verse.lines:
Goodness and mercy all my life
Shall surely follow me,

verse.name: v5b
verse.lines:
And in God's house forevermore
My dwelling place shall be.
Amen.
